revised_title: Solar Irradiance, Air Pollution, and Temperature Changes in the Arctic
tldr: This article investigates the decrease in solar irradiance and changes in temperature and air pollution in the Arctic over the past 40 years. The authors found a significant decrease in global irradiance, which they attribute to the influx of polluted air from industrial regions of the Northern Hemisphere. This pollution-induced cooling could explain the absence of temperature increases in the Arctic, as it offsets the enhanced surface warming predicted by general circulation models.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate Change
